gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Department of Transportation, Business Information and Technology Systems, GIS Mapping

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN is a line shapefile that shows the Federal Highway Administration functional classification of roadways in the Indiana Statewide Travel Demand Model, (ISTDM). Functional classification generally is the process by which streets and highways are grouped into classes, or systems, according to the character of the service they are intended to provide year to year. This file is a subset of the Indiana Statewide Travel Demand Model, (ISTDM). The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by INDOT for the source feature class named FUNC_CLASS: Functional Class values on all highway, county and city routes. Functional Class key: 1 - Interstate 3 - Other Principal Arterial (OPA) 2 - Principal Arterial (Freeway/Exprswy) 4 - Minor Arterial 5 - Major Collector 6 - Minor Collector 7 - Local

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide all functional class roadways in Indiana (as maintained by INDOT) in a GIS format.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: GIS Map Department, Business Information and Technology Systems, GIS Mapping, supplied by INDOT personnel Joel Bump.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Department of Transportation, GIS Coordinator

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. The following source citation should be included: [FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN: Functional Classification of Roadways in Indiana (from INDOT Statewide Travel Demand MODEL), 2012 (Indiana Department of Transportation, Line Shapefile)]. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be complete.
This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
Unknown, however use with high accuracy aerial imagery has shown highway positions to be highly accurate.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The base_2000 file from the Indiana Statewide Travel Demand Model, version 4, (ISTDM4) was converted in TransCAD to an ESRI ArcView Shapefile. All roadways in Indiana in the model were included in the subset, however centroid connectors were removed. Numerous attribute fields were removed to result in the basic roadway information.

IGS personnel received an ESRI file geodatabase containing a line feature class named "FUNC_CLASS" from INDOT personnel on June 26, 2012. FUNC_CLASS feature class was loaded into ESRI ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then exported the feature class to an ESRI shapefile format named as "FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN.SHP".

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
All roadways in Indiana with functional classification attributes (current as of June 26, 2012)

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: FUNC_CLASS (ESRI Line feature class containing all roadways in Indiana with functional classification attributes)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
